results.title: The Phase contrast microscope [Silent]
results.creator_credit: G.G. Grand and B Troughton + Simms Ltd
results.brief_description: Explains the properties of light and image formation in a normal microscope, and the effect of the Zernike disc in transforming changes in wave phase into changes in amplitudes to phase-contrast microscope is shown in use, with some examples of images invisible by normal miscroscopy.

results.title: Plant Supervisors Problems
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: The Trouble with women
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Plant Supervisors Problems”.
Historically interesting film - to be taken in context to the year it was produced, ie the 1950’s! A supervisor, Brad, discusses his objections to a new woman worker with the Personnel Manager. He recalls trouble with previous women employees: one kept her desk like a dressing table and objected to moving to a different one; another engaged girl gave insufficient notice of leaving to marry; then there was absenteeism. The Personnel Manager suggests that it is up to Brad whether the new “girl” adds up to trouble. The audience is asked: “What is Brad’s trouble?” Useful for feminist theory studies.

results.title: The Personal problem
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Plant Supervisors Problems”.
Shows that a supervisor who avoids discussing an employee’s personal problem with him may cause a production fall-off by the worker.

results.title: The Pedestrian strikes back
results.creator_credit: Jack L. Copeland, Copeland Productions and KNBC (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.)
results.brief_description: Assesses the national trend of revitalising the downtown core of cities through the construction of malls, focusing upon Burbank’s Golden Mall, and comparing it with similar projects throughout California. Authorities analyse the need for malls and discuss the difficulties encountered in providing them.

results.title: The Patched up fashion plate
results.brief_description: A girl (Linda Ingram) living in a battered timber house patches a pair of jeans. She walks among the second hand stores of Prahran and then the fashion boutiques of Toorak Road.

results.title: The Parting
results.brief_description: This film, in revealing some of the life and the ritual of death in this village in the Montenegro area of Yugoslavia, promotes examination of our own customs, of our own beliefs, and of those fears and hopes which the recognition of death awakens in each of us.

results.title: The Panda
results.creator_credit: Shanghai Scientific and Educational Film Studio
results.brief_description: The Panda is a survivor from ancient times and now is only found in the North of China. They were almost extinct, but the care by forest rangers and the people of China has assured their survival.
results.description: The Panda is a survivor from ancient times and now is only found in the North of China. They were almost extinct, but the care by forest rangers and the people of China has assured their survival.

results.title: The Painted men
results.brief_description: Filmed in and around Hanuabada village, Port Moresby, this story of the abduction of a native girl by ”painted men” and her rescue by her lover was made for the entertainment of local audiences. It is claimed to be the first Papua New Guinean film with an indigenous cast.
results.description: Filmed in and around Hanuabada village, Port Moresby, this story of the abduction of a native girl by ”painted men” and her rescue by her lover was made for the entertainment of local audiences. It is claimed to be the first Papua New Guinean film with an indigenous cast.

results.title: The Origins of film: the African American cinema
results.creator_credit: Colored Players Film Corp, DeForest Phonofilms and Micheaux Book and Film Co
results.brief_description: Volume one of a three disc anthology of restored early silent American films (1900-1926) from archival prints held in the Library of Congress’s Motion Picture, Broadcasting and Recorded Sound Division. This volume focuses on early African American Cinema. “Within our gates”: one of the earliest silent films directed by an African American is this melodrama about the efforts of a black woman with a tragic past to raise funds for a school for black children in the South. The film dealt with provocative issues of the time, such as overt racism, lynching, and the sorry state of education for the black community. Micheaux’s use of a mixed race cast allowed for a more complicated exploration of such issues than all-black “race movies” or Hollywood studio productions. “Scar of shame” was one of the few silent films made specifically for black audiences known to have survived. The story concerns an uneducated dark-skinned girl who forces an upright middle-class piano teacher into marriage. While it follows many of the conventions of Hollywood social melodrama and was produced, written and directed by whites it is recognised for its projection of an authentic black point of view and for its accurate portrayal of black social mores, particularly of the caste, class and colour divisions amongst middle class blacks and of the tensions between middle class and street life. In “Noble Sissle and Eubie Blake” the entertainers of the title perform two songs. A booklet containing notes about the filmmakers, the restoration process, the context in which the films were made, and synopses is included.
